au.gov.naa.digipres.xena.kernel.view
Class ViewManager

java.lang.Object
  au.gov.naa.digipres.xena.kernel.view.ViewManager

public class ViewManager
extends java.lang.Object

Class for managing views within Xena. Those methods that return a usable view require you to pass a "level". This is the level within the gui hierarchy that the view will be used at. For simple views this will be 0. But where views are nested within views the number will be increasing according to its nestedness. Knowing how deep a view is nested can be useful for various functions.

                       int level,

lookup

public java.util.List<XenaView> lookup(java.lang.String xmlTag,
                                       int level)
                                throws XenaException
Determines a list of XenaFileTypes based on the given XML tag. Don't use the returned view object for a real view!!! The views returned should be considered templates only. They need to be cloned, before being used. Pass the value to lookup(Class, int level) before you use! If you don't do this, very weird stuff is likely to happen.

Parameters:
xmlTag - XML tag of top level name.
Returns:
list of XenaViews associated with given XML tag
Throws:
XenaException
